_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    MFA Bulk Plant - Tipton

Location:    74986 Hwy. 50, Tipton, Mo.

Contact:     Michael Catron

Phone:             660-433-5549



1. The Facility Policy



MFA Incorporated and the employees of the MFA Bulk Plant near Tipton are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Moniteau County LEPC and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of bulk dry fertilizer and anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient.



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program



The Accidental Release Prevention Program for the location consists of following the provisions of:



a.    40 CFR Part 68

b.    OSHA 29 CFR 1910.111

c.    Missouri Anhydrous Ammonia Law

d.    CGA G.2.1 - 2014

e.    ANSI K61.1 - 1999



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program



    The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency planning and community 

       right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees will not respond to any release other than to activate an emergency shut-off

           while evacuating the facility. Local emergency responders will be notified to control

           any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety



Safety improvement is an on-going pro

cess at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the condition and operation of the facility and improvements are made where warranted.







    2/28/18
